link.title: Treutlen Elementary School - News

form.name: aspnetForm

div.label: Translate Page

span.p: System and school administrators met to plan for modifying the grading process for the 2019-2020 school year. Parent portal will be disabled for a brief time beginning Friday, April 24, 2020, as the calculations must be completed manually and reloaded into the parent portal. Fourth nine-week grades will be the average of the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd nine weeks’ grades. Beginning next week, teachers will reach out to parents/students who are in jeopardy of failing with options for improving the grade from failing to passing. Distance learning work will be used only to improve a student’s overall average. May 13th will be the last day to receive all distance learning work for the 2019-2020 school year. Additional details will be available once final grade calculations and parent conversations with all students in jeopardy of failing has been completed.
The attendance procedures and consequences for lack of attendance will not be in effect for the 2019-2020 school year.
Prom has been canceled as the school system cannot meet the expected social distancing requirements as defined by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

The school system wishes to honor our 2020 graduates with a face-to-face graduation ceremony. At this time, we are optimistically hopeful of maintaining our original ceremony date by adding social distancing requirements. However, the decision to have a face-to-face ceremony is still too soon to decide. We will keep everyone up to date as details become available.

div.div:
Bradley S. Anderson, Ed. D.
Superintendent
Treutlen County Schools

span.p: Due to the latest shelter-in-place guidance, the earliest that Coca-Cola will deliver is Wednesday, May 6. We will have a drive-thru pick up in the front of TES on May 6 from 9:00 to 3:30. We will keep you updated if anything changes. Thank you for your patience as we work to keep our Vikings protected and safe!

a.title: Click to read more about: Coke Pick-up

span.p: The Treutlen County School system is now accepting applications for 2020-2021 Pre-K Registration. Registration packets may be picked up from the front of Treutlen Elementary School or downloaded below. Completed registration packets (with all documentation needed) can be returned to Treutlen Elementary School on Tuesday or Thursday of each week from 8am until 2pm (with the exception of Spring Break, April 6-10). Mrs. Christi Brantley will review the packet for completion when it is returned.

a.title: Click to read more about: Pre-K Registration 2020-2021

span.p: You can find the learning packets that have been created for our students here. These are the same packets that are being handed out to students on the food bus routes. We will post them every week for our students. We have also create a special place for other learning resources as well. These resources can be found on the top navigation Bar (RED Bar Above) under the School Closure Student/Parent Resources Button.

strong.font: The Vision of Treutlen County Schools: Preparing all students for success in life.
The Mission of Treutlen County Schools: Engage, Equip, and Inspire All for Success in Life.
